title.narrative: Spotlight Outcome: Accelerate efforts towards the elimination of VAWG, including SGBV/HP, by addressing their structural roots and linkages to SRHR.

description.narrative: Spotlight Outcome adopted from the Programme Goal

title.narrative: Legislative and police frameworks are reviewed in line with international human rights standards on all forms of violence against women and girls and harmful practices.

Number of draft revised laws and policies on SGBV/HP, SRHR, and on gender equality and non-discrimination harmonized and aligned with international HR standards and respond to the rights of women and girls, particularly those facing intersecting and multi

description.narrative: Number of draft revised laws and policies on SGBV/HP, SRHR, and on gender equality and non-discrimination harmonized and aligned with international HR standards and respond to the rights of women and girls, particularly those facing intersecting and multi

comment.narrative: Draft 5 laws and 2 policies reviewed which are not aligned to international standards
Draft 5 laws and 2 policies reviewed which are aligned to international standards

title.narrative: Number of parliamentarians and staff of human rights institutions with strengthened capacities to advocate for, draft new and or/ strengthened existing legislation and or policies on VAWG including SGBV/HP and or gender equality and non-discrimination inc

description.narrative: Number of parliamentarians and staff of human rights institutions with strengthened capacities to advocate for, draft new and or/ strengthened existing legislation and or policies on VAWG including SGBV/HP and or gender equality and non-discrimination inc

comment.narrative: 00 parliamentarians, 200 staff of human rights institutions

title.narrative: National and sub-national systems and institutions plan, fund and deliver evidence based programmes that prevent and respond to violence against women and girls and harmful practices.

Number of draft evidence-based national and/or sub-national action plans on ending VAWG, including SGBV/HP and promoting women and girls’ SRHR developed that respond to the rights of groups facing intersecting and multiple forms of discrimination with M&E

comment.narrative: 1 national costed plan and M&E framework, 6 district costed plans and M&E framework

title.narrative: Number of parliamentarians and staff of human rights institutions with strengthened capacities to advocate for, draft new and or/ strengthened existing legislation and or policies on VAWG including SGBV/HP and or gender equality and non-discrimination inc

comment.narrative: 100 parliamentarians, 200 staff of human rights institutions

title.narrative: Gender equitable social norms, attitudes and behaviour change promoted to prevent violence against women and girls and harmful practices.

Number of networks of men and boys developed and/or strengthened to advocate against VAWG including SGBV/HP and stand for promoting gender equitable values and behaviours, including on women and girls’ SRHR.

Women's and girls’ rights groups, autonomous social movements and relevant CSOs, including those representing youth and groups facing multiple and intersecting forms of discrimination/marginalization, influence and advance progress on GEWE and VAWG, incl

Number of official dialogues with relevant government authorities with the meaningful participation of women's rights groups and relevant CSOs, including representatives of groups facing multiple and intersecting forms of discrimination

comment.narrative: 2 National level official dialogue sessions; 12 district based official dialogue sessions

title.narrative: Number of supported women's right groups and relevant CSOs using the appropriate accountability mechanisms for advocacy

comment.narrative: 30 Women Rights groups, and 60 CSOs leaders supported with capacity building in social accountability mechanisms

title.narrative: Percentage of CSOs that use of social accountability mechanisms in order to monitor and engage in efforts to end VAWG, including SGBV/HP, and promote women and girls’ SRHR

Number of National women’s and girls’ networks and relevant CSOs with strengthened capacities to network, partner and jointly advocate for progress on ending VAWG including SGBV/HP and on the promotion of women and girls SRHR at local, national, regional

comment.narrative: 2 National level official dialogue sessions with national goverment authorities; 12 district based official dialogue sessions (Numbers will be maintained as scheduled events)

title.narrative: Number of National women’s and girls’ networks and relevant CSOs with strengthened capacities to network, partner and jointly advocate for progress on ending VAWG including SGBV/HP and on the promotion of women and girls SRHR at local, national, regional
